com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class DocumentViewer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.DocumentViewer

  • public abstract class DocumentViewer
extends Object
    A viewer displays one (or more) Geneious documents to the user.

    DocumentViewers are created via DocumentViewerFactory.createViewer(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.AnnotatedPluginDocument[]).

    A plugin may provide a set of DocumentViewerFactories via GeneiousPlugin.getDocumentViewerFactories().

    • Method Detail

      • getComponent

        public abstract JComponent getComponent()
        Get the graphical component displayed to the user. May return null to have no viewer displayed (this should only be used if the selection signature is not sufficient).
        Returns:
        the graphical component displayed to the user.

      • getPrintableComponent

        public JComponent getPrintableComponent()
        Returns the component that Geneious should print (if not the component returned by getComponent(). This method is only used if getPrintable() and getExtendedPrintable() both return null.
        Returns:
        the component to print, or null to use the same component as getComponent()
        See Also:
        getPrintable(), ()

      • getPrintable

        public Printable getPrintable()
        Get a Printable for handling printing and saving as an image If getExtendedPrintable() is implemented and returns a non null value, this method will not be used.
        Returns:
        a Printable or null if this DocumentViewer doesn't have special printable support
        See Also:
        getExtendedPrintable(), getPrintableComponent()

      • getExtendedPrintable

        public ExtendedPrintable getExtendedPrintable()
        Get an ExtendedPrintable for providing advanced printing and saving to image support. If this method returns a non null value, getPrintable() need not be implemented and should not be called.
        Returns:
        an ExtendedPrintable or null if this DocumentViewer doesn't have special printable support
        See Also:
        getPrintable(), getPrintableComponent()

      • getFindable

        public Findable getFindable()
        Provide support for this DocumentViewer to interact with the find text dialog
        Returns:
        a Findable or null if this DocumentViewer doesn't have special finding support

      • getActionProvider

        public ActionProvider getActionProvider()
        Provide support for this DocumentViewer interacting with copy/paste etc, or any custom actions.
        Returns:
        an ActionProvider or null if this DocumentViewer doesn't have special action support

      • getNoLongerViewedListener

        public NoLongerViewedListener getNoLongerViewedListener()
        Used to provide notification to the DocumentViewer when the user is no longer interested in viewing it.
        Returns:
        a NoLongerViewedListener or null if this DocumentViewer doesn't need to perform any special action when it's no longer viewed

      • getIncomingMessageHandler

        public DocumentViewerMessageHandler getIncomingMessageHandler()
        Viewer handling for incoming messages. DocumentViewerMessageHandler.handleMessage(org.jdom.Element, String, boolean) will be called whenever a message is received from any other viewer.

        See DocumentViewerMessageHandler for a description of what this means.

        Returns:
        a handler which accepts messages for this viewer.

      • setOutgoingMessageHandler

        public final void setOutgoingMessageHandler(DocumentViewerMessageHandler handler)
        Set the outgoing message handler. Only used internally by Geneious. A DocumentViewer should call getOutgoingMessageHandler() to send outgoing messages.

        See DocumentViewerMessageHandler for a description of what this means.

        Parameters:
        handler - - viewer may send messages using handler.handleMessage()

      • getOutgoingMessageHandler

        public DocumentViewerMessageHandler getOutgoingMessageHandler()
        Get the outgoing message handler. Call DocumentViewerMessageHandler.handleMessage(org.jdom.Element, String, boolean) to send a message to all other viewers.

        See DocumentViewerMessageHandler for a description of what this means.

        Returns:
        a DocumentViewerMessageHandler that this document viewer can use for sending messages.

      • setEditingEnabled

        public void setEditingEnabled(boolean isEditingEnabled,
                     String reasonDisabled)
        This method should be overridden if the viewer allows editing of documents. By default editing should be enabled, but in some cases (eg. documents that aren't in the local database) this will be called to disable editing in which case the user should not be allowed to perform any editing.

        This method will never be called when the viewer has unsaved changes (ie. when the save action is enabled).

        The core program calls this method so plugins don't need to.

        Parameters:
        isEditingEnabled - false to prevent the user editing in the viewer
        reasonDisabled - a message describing why editing has been disabled. Will be displayed to the user if they try to edit. Can be an HTML fragment. May only be null if isEditingEnabled is true.
        Since:
        API 4.11 (Geneious 5.0)

      • setInSplitLayout

        public void setInSplitLayout(DocumentViewer.ViewerLocation location)
        This method can optionally be overridden so the viewer is notified when it becomes part of a split layout (multiple views on the same document). This has two main purposes:
        1. When in a split layout, viewers should try to reduce their required space depending on adjacent viewers. eg. If isBesideAnotherViewer is true then the side options panel should be collapsed.
        2. If the viewer has per-document view preferences then the preferences should be stored independently for each viewer in the layout. layoutPositionIdentifier can be used as a preference prefix for this purpose.

        This method is not always called on a viewer and it can be called at any time. When called, the viewer should (in this order):
        1. Save any per-document view preference for the previous split location
        2. Adjust any layout appropriately
        3. Load any preferences that are unique to the new position. The viewer should however load the non-split preferences before loading the relevant split ones in case this is the first time the viewer has been in the new split position.
        Parameters:
        location - contains information about the location of the viewer in the split layout.
        Since:
        API 4.11 (Geneious 5.0)

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Returns:
        the name to display as the title for this viewer, or null to use the name returned from the factory that created the viewer instead (DocumentViewerFactory.getName()
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)
        See Also:
        DocumentViewerFactory.getName()
